alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Okeechobee and southeastern Osceola Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Kissimmee Prarie Preserve, or 16 miles south of Lake Marian, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kissimmee Prarie Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
